title: After all the feedback that you ignored, Riot, I just have one final thing to say.
body:
Fuck you.

End of statement. Nothing else to add, really. You already know the rest.

If you're going to disrespect us like this, then I have no reason to show respect back. Good bye.

replies.body: The video really shows they are missing a huge point that is skewing all of their opinions and viewpoints: **They assume ALL players want to play with friends or other players. ** I don't play with friends, I don't have friends that play this game, I don't play this game to make friends, I like to play this game alone  - these are HUGE points that a lot of players who are calling for Solo Q to come back. Riot has completely screwed themselves and I don't want to quit this game but ranked is a really big part of this. It's really just a sad situation to be in. The player base has been screaming until we are hoarse and Riot just isn't listening.

We're being overpowered by the hoards of casuals that still play the game. We, the ones who have spent YEARS on this game, are dedicated to League of Legends and they aren't listening to us. I guess its because we aren't bringing in enough money?

> [{quoted}](name=KarmaCatchesUp2U,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=l8iGzznp,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-06-01T01:01:13.929+0000)
>

you're right, there are two doors, the casual door, and the dedicated door. The casual door is a revolving door where it's users will leave and enter the game with a single balance change, or if the game takes too long. The dedicated door is a "push-to-open" that is quite heavy where it takes a lot of effort to get in and get out where it's users can handle unbalanced broken shit, or long games, but they have a limit but they also have patience.

Rather than preserve the Staying power of leagues playerbase, Riot is busting down the "push-to-open" doors and replacing them with revolving doors where their playerbase will eventually fluctuate like WoW's losing millions of customers in a single patch but also gaining millions back in another one.

Stop being so condescending. It's not as simple as "casuals like duo queue and hardcore players don't", and even if it was there's nothing that makes the hardcore players any more deserving of attention than casual players. Players are players. 

If you want to argue for one queue or the other, go for it, but try not to be so elitist about it.

I'm not being elitist. I'm saying that the players who made League of Legends as popular as it is now are being ignored in favor for newer players or players who do not spend as much time on the game. If you're a casual, then fine. There's nothing wrong with that. There's nothing *better* about being a dedicated player either. So I'm unsure as to where I'm sounding "elitist".
